G3101.def: (derivative of {L:μαθητεύω<SDBG:μαθητεύω:000000>}[a] ‘to follow, to be a disciple of,’ {D:36.31}) a person who is a disciple or follower of someone

G588.def: to accept the presence of a person with friendliness{N:001}

G3854.def: to come to be present at a particular place

G3739.def: a relative reference to any entity, event, or state, either occurring overtly in the immediate context or clearly implied in the discourse or setting

G4183.def: a relatively large quantity of objects or events

G4820.def: to give careful consideration to various implications of an issue

G1223.def: (with the genitive) a marker of intermediate agent, with implicit or explicit causative agent

G5485.def: to show kindness to someone, with the implication of graciousness on the part of the one showing such kindness

G4100.def: to believe something to be true and, hence, worthy of being trusted{N:001}

G1063.def: a marker of cause or reason between events, though in some contexts the relation is often remote or tenuous

G2159.def: a relatively high point on a scale of extent and implying tension and opposition{N:001}

G1246.def: to refute completely in a debate

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G1219.def: pertaining to being able to be known by the public

G1223.def: (with the genitive) a marker of intermediate agent, with implicit or explicit causative agent

G1124.def: a particular portion or unit of discourse{N:001}

G5547.def: (literally: one who has been anointed) in the NT, titles for Jesus as the Messiah, but in many contexts, and especially without an article, Χριστός becomes a part of the name of Jesus; see {D:93.387})
